docs.snippet: CBS expanded its selection show to two hours to draw out the suspense over who would play where, and fans reacted with disdain....
docs.lead_paragraph: CBS expanded its selection show to two hours to draw out the suspense over who would play where, and fans reacted with disdain.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column criticizes CBS for unnecessarily drawing out NCAA tournament selection program to two hours.

headline.main: As CBS Dawdles, Fans Are First to Be Upset in This Tournament

docs.snippet: The district attorney investigating the latest hazing case in high school sports says all coaches need to be present and proactive in fighting these brutal sports rituals....
docs.lead_paragraph: The district attorney investigating the latest hazing case in high school sports says all coaches need to be present and proactive in fighting these brutal sports rituals.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column describes feeling sense of deja vu while reporting on accusations of brutal hazing and sexual assault of football player at Conestoga High School in Chestery County, Pa; notes case is but one of many similar incidents across country; suggests best way to prevent such attacks is to make sure adults are present and accountable.

headline.main: Something Is Missing in High School Hazing Stories: Adults
headline.print_headline: Something Is Missing in Hazing Stories: Adults

docs.snippet: Davis, who played 13 seasons in the N.B.A. before an injury tore up his right knee, is attempting a comeback with the Delaware 87ers of the N.B.A. Development League....
docs.lead_paragraph: Davis, who played 13 seasons in the N.B.A. before an injury tore up his right knee, is attempting a comeback with the Delaware 87ers of the N.B.A. Development League.
docs.abstract: Former NBA point guard Baron Davis, who sustained seemingly career-ending knee injury in 2012, is attempting comeback by proving his capabilities on NBA Development League team Delaware 87ers.

headline.main: Baron Davis Seeks to Rewrite His Career’s Sad Ending
headline.print_headline: Seeking to Rewrite a Career’s Sad Ending

docs.snippet: The Obama administration punched a new series of holes in the U.S. trade embargo on Cuba on Tuesday, removing the last meaningful restrictions on travel and enacting other changes to expand U.S. commerce with the island. The sweeping shift comes a...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration punched a new series of holes in the U.S. trade embargo on Cuba on Tuesday, removing the last meaningful restrictions on travel and enacting other changes to expand U.S. commerce with the island. The sweeping shift comes ahead of an historic three-day trip to Cuba that President Barack Obama will begin on Sunday.

headline.main: What's Changing in US Rules for Travel, Commerce With Cuba
headline.print_headline: What's Changing in US Rules for Travel, Commerce With Cuba

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama sent an unmistakable message to Americans on Tuesday ahead of his historic trip to Havana: Cuba is open for business....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama sent an unmistakable message to Americans on Tuesday ahead of his historic trip to Havana: Cuba is open for business.

headline.main: Obama Abolishes Last Major Restrictions on US Travel to Cuba
headline.print_headline: Obama Abolishes Last Major Restrictions on US Travel to Cuba

docs.snippet: In basketball, in politics and in life: We like the little guy. Until we actually want to win, and then we don’t....
docs.lead_paragraph: In basketball, in politics and in life: We like the little guy. Until we actually want to win, and then we don’t.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by authors L Jon Wertheim and Sam Sommers highlights research exploring reasons people have affinity for underdogs, in light of NCAA basketball tournament, which is typically characterized by fans flocking to support underdog teams.

headline.main: The Eternal Appeal of the Underdog
headline.print_headline: The Eternal Appeal of the Underdog
